options: Do algae use sunlight to make food?

centerpiece: A student conducts an experiment to determine the average size of acorn that squirrels eat. The student gave several different sizes of acorns to a squirrel. Which action would most likely improve the results?

India is in the Northern Hemisphere and Australia is in the Southern Hemisphere. In June, it is summer in India and winter in Australia. What is the main reason the seasons are opposite in the two countries?
options: because Earth is tilted on its axis
because the Sun rotates on its axis
because Earth revolves around the Sun
because of the distance between the countries
correct_options_literal: because Earth is tilted on its axis

Oak trees produce seeds that are contained in acorns. Blue jays eat the seeds in acorns. Blue jays also collect acorns and hide them in the ground, often far away from the parent oak tree. Blue jays do not eat the seed of every acorn they hide. How do oak trees benefit from blue jays' collecting and hiding acorns?
options: The oak trees are pollinated by the blue jays.
The oak trees are protected from other herbivores.
The seeds of oak trees are protected from the sun.
The seeds of oak trees are planted in new environments.
correct_options_literal: The seeds of oak trees are planted in new environments.

centerpiece: Which step of the scientific method will follow after a student graphs collected data during a lab experiment?

options: Animal cells are missing a nucleus.
Only plant cells have a cell membrane.
Animal cells include a rigid wall structure.

centerpiece: Which kind of events can form mountains?
During the early 1990s, people began using cell phones to communicate. The development of the cell phone was most likely a response to the need of society to
options: be able to communicate when sick.
provide a safer method of communicating.
provide more jobs in the communication industry.
be able to communicate when away from home.
correct_options_literal: be able to communicate when away from home.

options: Earth is covered mostly with water.

centerpiece: Scientists found evidence of past glacial activity in Massachusetts. Which of the following conclusions is best supported by this evidence?
options: Sea levels were much higher in the past.
The climate on Earth has changed over time.
Total numbers of organisms on Earth have changed over time.
The total amount of radiation from the Sun was much higher in the past.
correct_options_literal: The climate on Earth has changed over time.

centerpiece: Which statement explains why a mother's unhealthy diet during pregnancy is harmful to her embryo's development?
options: The embryo inherits half its chromosomes from its mother.
The embryo receives its food from its mother through the placenta.
The embryo receives oxygen through the placenta.
The embryo receives mutations carried by its mother.
correct_options_literal: The embryo receives its food from its mother through the placenta.

Which statement about the genetic traits of humans is true?
options: Recessive forms of genes are always visible in offspring.
Visible traits are the same for each member of a family.
Dominant forms of genes are always inherited from both parents.
Visible traits depend on the dominant and recessive forms of genes from each parent.
correct_options_literal: Visible traits depend on the dominant and recessive forms of genes from each parent.

centerpiece: Geotropism is a response by plants to which force?

options: identical bases in the same order
complementary bases in the same order
identical bases in the reverse order
complementary bases in the reverse order
correct_options_literal: complementary bases in the same order

centerpiece: If the environment in an area is destroyed, a new community of organisms sometimes takes the place of previous communities. The introduction of a new community of organisms is known as
The formula X + ZY -> XZ + Y shows that
options: X and Y bonded into a more complex molecule.
ZY has decomposed into two smaller compounds.
X is a more reactive compound than Y.
Y has changed into a new compound.
correct_options_literal: X is a more reactive compound than Y.

centerpiece: Alisha's teacher glued a needle to a piece of cork so that the needle would float. Then he used a magnet to magnetize the needle. When the needle was placed in a bowl of water, it turned to point north. Which best describes the reason that the needle pointed north?
options: The cork must also have been magnetized.
The magnetic field of Earth affected the needle.
The magnetic current in the bowl of water affected the needle.
The teacher must have placed the magnet to the south of the bowl.
correct_options_literal: The magnetic field of Earth affected the needle.

centerpiece: A population of plants growing on an island consisted of two varieties, one with thorns and the other without. Over a period of many years, the variety with thorns gradually disappeared. Which process most likely brought about this change in the plant population?

While hiking last year, Mike saw a large boulder next to a mountain trail. The boulder had no cracks. While hiking on the trail this year, he saw two large cracks in the boulder. Which of the following most likely caused these cracks to form?
options: erosion due to falling rain and snow
weathering due to freezing and thawing
correct_options_literal: weathering due to freezing and thawing

centerpiece: Many animals blend in with their environment and can not be easily seen by predators. This is an example of which adaptation?

Which model can be used to trace genetic inheritance?
Which statement best describes an atom with an atomic number of 20?
options: The sum of the number of protons and electrons is 20.
The sum of the number of protons and neutrons is 20.

centerpiece: Scientists have developed an allergy medication from a plant that is part of the rainforest food chain. What concern might develop when producing this medication from the plant?
options: increase in allergies in rainforest wildlife
lack of patients to test the new medication
decrease in a food source to rainforest wildlife
correct_options_literal: decrease in a food source to rainforest wildlife

centerpiece: Granite is a hard material and forms from cooling magma. Granite is a type of
Seismic waves occur as a result of an earthquake. Which statement describes a wave property that makes it possible for scientists to locate the source of an earthquake?
options: The wavelength of a wave is measured from crest to crest.
Waves travel uniformly outward from the wave source.
The frequency of waves varies in different mediums.
Waves move at the same speed in different materials.
correct_options_literal: Waves travel uniformly outward from the wave source.

centerpiece: Which is most important to do when making directions for an experiment?
options: Name how many experiments have been done.
Tell how to do a different experiment.
Show the results of the experiment.

centerpiece: A scientist is trying to decide whether an organism is unicellular or multicellular. Which information would help the scientist most to make her decision?
options: size of the cells of the organism
how many types of cells are in the organism
correct_options_literal: how many types of cells are in the organism

centerpiece: During digestion, strong acids are added to food to help break down the food chemically. Into which organ are most of these acids added?

A science teacher is discussing the immune system with his class. Which statement should the teacher make about this system?
options: It produces new cells to carry oxygen.
It produces chemicals to regulate growth.
It produces antibodies to fight bacteria.
It produces electrical signals to control the body.
correct_options_literal: It produces antibodies to fight bacteria.

centerpiece: Which of the following has been formed on the Asian continent by two continental plates that have been pressing together for millions of years?
options: large freshwater lakes linked by rivers
an uneven thickness of sedimentary layers

centerpiece: Before large trees could grow on Earth, what had to happen first?
options: Rocks were eroded to form soil.
Earth's gravity accumulated to modern levels.
Volcanoes exploded to form mountaintop lakes.
correct_options_literal: Rocks were eroded to form soil.

In Colonial America, people used ice to help keep foods fresh. They cut the ice from lakes and ponds during the winter and stored the ice in ice houses. They sometimes used hay as an insulator to prevent the ice from melting. If you wanted to build an icehouse today, which of the following would be the best material to use as an insulator?

Tides, such as those along the coast of Massachusetts, are caused by gravitational attractions acting on Earth. Why is the gravitational attraction of the Moon a greater factor in determining tides than the gravitational attraction of the much larger Sun?
options: Earth is much closer to the Moon than to the Sun.
The Sun's gravity is a factor only during the day.
The Moon's core has a much greater density than the Sun's core.
The Sun's mass is smaller than the mass of the Moon.
correct_options_literal: Earth is much closer to the Moon than to the Sun.

centerpiece: A group of students compared the effects of fertilizer on the growth of tomato plants. The students gave six tomato plants Fertilizer 1 and six other tomato plants Fertilizer 2. They grew the plants under the same conditions. After several weeks, the students concluded that the tomato plants that received Fertilizer 1 grew taller than those that received Fertilizer 2. Which of the following actions would have increased the accuracy of the results of this investigation?
options: using different growing conditions for a group of the plants
growing a group of tomato plants without fertilizer
growing different types of plants with each fertilizer
applying a combination of fertilizers to all the plants
correct_options_literal: growing a group of tomato plants without fertilizer

Wave energy from the ocean can be harnessed to power generators to make electricity. Energy from ocean tides can also be used to make electricity. How would you categorize these two sources of energy?
options: Wave energy is nonrenewable. Tidal energy is renewable.
Wave energy is renewable. Tidal energy is nonrenewable.

centerpiece: Algae are organisms that live in water. Scientists discovered a new type of red algae near Knight Island in Prince William Sound. Which statement is most likely a positive effect of this discovery?
options: Scientists studying the red algae are disturbing local wildlife.
The red algae may help scientists better understand local food webs.
Visitors to Alaska may want to collect the red algae and take it home.
The red algae may be moved by boat to other areas when people travel.
correct_options_literal: The red algae may help scientists better understand local food webs.
